title: Muhammad Zia-ul-Haq
summary: General Muhammad Zia-ul-Haq (12 August 1924 â€“ 17 August 1988) was a four-star general who became the sixth President of Pakistan after declaring martial law in 1977. He served as the head of state from 1978 until his death in a plane crash in 1988. He remains the country's longest-serving head of state and Chief of Army Staff.
